alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Fulton; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 4:18AM EST until March 12 at 9:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Ohio... Tippecanoe River above Winamac affecting Pulaski, White and Carroll Counties. Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Pulaski, Marshall, Starke, Fulton IN and Kosciusko Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Defiance, Allen IN and De Kalb Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Defiance, Williams and Fulton OH Counties. North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. .Recent rainfall and snowmelt led to rises on area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tiffin River at Stryker. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters begin to affect some farm buildings near Stryker and flood some secondary roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM EST Wednesday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
